conversion_verification.notes: Second image is an angled cutaway render with wall height, thickness, multi-face wall geometry, and roof/ceiling removed exposing interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion with readable room volumes and clean corner geometry; cutaway is mostly clean with minor simplifications in wall junction details.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall 3BHK arrangement is preserved (central living/dining, kitchen+utility to the right, multiple toilets, two balconies). Some internal partition positions/room proportions and a few doorway placements appear simplified versus the annotated 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (beds, sofa set, dining table) and kitchen/bath fixtures are represented; furniture is somewhat generic but generally placed in the correct rooms with mostly reasonable scale.

visual_clarity.notes: Good separation of floors/walls/openings, consistent materials, clean background. Lighting and camera angle keep most spaces readable with minimal distortion.

detected_errors.description: Internal partitions and some room proportion relationships appear simplified compared to the detailed 2D plan (not all wall lengths/offsets match precisely).
Several door/opening positions and swing/orientation details do not strictly match the 2D plan or are not fully represented.
Furniture and fixtures are simplified; not all spaces show the full set of elements implied by the 2D plan.

summary: This is a true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, but with noticeable simplification in internal wall/door geometry and some proportional deviations from the 2D plan.
